channel.title: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?
channel.description: i need to add a better ban like MAC or something can anyone please help?

item.title: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

you will always be able to evade a ban given you have Internet, and you know exactly what is stopping you from connecting.

uid can be changed.
ips can be masked/proxies/vpns etc

you’re not going to be able to stop anyone for good.

Read full topic
item.source: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?

item.title: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

MAC ban is bad idea, its client sided and is override-able. I know what i am talking about, and i am not saying the client says weather it is banned or not. I am saying the client tells the server it’s mac address, so it can tell the server anything the client wants it too.

Read full topic
item.source: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?

item.title: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Driman Rune, post:12, topic:529322”]I will show you some of my code powers:

set InternetProtocol to IP(setTrue());
IF User.ConnectedFromIP(127.0.0.1) then do
                    User.stop(setTrue());
ELSE
                    User.continue(setTrue());
END STATEMENT

My Corbasic1.6 code.[/quote]
Completely irrelevant, go away.

@OP: For the lols take n10si t’s advice, my suggestion is that you hide a simple binary file somewhere in the users files (be careful the location you choose, as certain anti-virus programs may see this and flag it as malicious, and warn the user), and have it store a simple boolean value, false or true for ban. Then edit your login protocol to check this. Just pick somewhere that they wouldn’t look (for instance, don’t store it in the players cache), or somewhere that programs like ccleaner remove from often. I suppose appdata would work, just make a common folder name, like “Microsoft Drivers” or something like that, and if someone figures it out, change the folder location, and make them start again

Read full topic
item.source: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?

item.title: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?
item.dc:creator: @Driman_Rune Driman Rune
item.description:
@Driman_Rune wrote:

I will show you some of my code powers:

set InternetProtocol to IP(setTrue());
IF User.ConnectedFromIP(127.0.0.1) then do
                    User.stop(setTrue());
ELSE
                    User.continue(setTrue());
END STATEMENT

My Corbasic1.6 code.

Read full topic

4,228,250,625 (even though some of these are not pingable.)

guaranteed way to ban the 1/4,228,250,625 addresses: shut off your server[/quote]

If you think about it, I still win.

item.title: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:8, topic:529322”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=648077.msg4359140#msg4359140 date=1378333960]

Sorry, I just assumed you were using something along the lines of PI.

You should have a ‘net’ package somewhere, and there should be a file similar to HostList in there. Check wherever it checks if an IP is banned or not.

@sk8r:
I know. But hey, whatever works, right?

Removing 65025 potential IP’s is fun right?
[/quote]

Hey, if I wanted somebody gone that bad, I have no problem banning him and his entire city.[/quote]
Have fun banning over a million IPs.

darrien21:

yea im looking for somthing like sk8 but i want it in 718 form

Then convert it.

item.title: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That would be a really bad idea, n10si… Seeing as I could happen to have the same two bytes as someone else for my IP, there’s only so many IP’s out there, and there’s a lot more devices…

This was made for PI [317], but can be converted:
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/tutorials/427669-pi-uuid-banning.html

Read full topic

item.source: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?

item.title: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

Most IP changers only change the last two numbers of the IP. For example, “192.168.1.3” becomes “192.168.2.4”.

So, a simple work around is to head into your HostList.java and where it checks to see if the IP connecting is banned or not, try putting something roughly along the lines of:

if (addr.startsWith("192.168")) { return false; }

I know that you’d have to shut down and compile the server every time to add another IP, but like I said, this is a very simple way of doing it.

Read full topic
item.source: Help adding a better ban than just ip!?
